column4: help, anyway to unmount a cd drive, umount -f does not work ?
umount says the resource is busy
and i need to insert cd 3
Probaby means there was a hardware error or an open file - lsof |grep /path/to/cd ...
yes i am running as root
yeah cedega game
on 4 cds
that command did nothing went straight back to the prompt
i got 2 cds installed using different drives, but i have run out half way through
need to get cd out to continue install
if you did it right, indicates no open files- probably hardware glitch.
anything i can do about it ?
Sounds like you restart the install to me...
doubt that will work, on bases it has locked both cd drives
so its probably not a one of
what would using a paper clip and forcing the eject on hardware side do ?
not unmount the disk, certainly.
Only physically remove the medium, it won't free up the wedge.  (I bet.)
